page.title: 18HOUSES IN LITTLE WITLEY-2
page.content: { Since 1945}brick houses with tiled roofs have been built. Older members of the community often live in bungaloes with plated glass windows overlooking the hills and valleys. Some of these houses have wide glass doors and double glazed windows. {Recent farm buildings}are functional made from prefabricated steel uprights supporting corrugated iron roofs. Glasshouses cover a wide area. Fine old barns with honeycombed brick are being converted into dwellings. The{chapel}is made from sandstone blocks with arched windows. The former {school}(now a private house) is also built of sandstone with arched and latticed windows. The village{garage is a concrete and metal structure; while the much used village hall is mainly built of wood.There are no shops, but one permanent caravan site.
